title: How to Make Baked Cinnamon Applesauce Doughnuts

steps.headline: Dissolve the yeast in warm water in a large bowl and let it stand 5 minutes.
Add three cups flour, applesauce, and the next 6 ingredients (see ingredients): beat at low speed of electric mixer until moistened.
Beat at medium speed for an additional 2 minutes.
Stir in 2 cups of flour, 1/2 cups at a time, to form a soft dough.
Turn out onto a well-floured surface.
Knead until smooth and elastic(about 5 minutes); add enough remaining flour, 1 tablespoon at a time, to prevent dough from sticking to hands.
Place dough in a bowl coated with cooking spray.
Cover and let rise in a warm place, free from drafts for 1 hour or until doubled in bulk.
Punch dough down, and turn out onto a lightly floured surface.
Roll dough to a ⁄2 inch (1.3 cm) thickness:cut it lightly
Combine doughnut holes and any remaining scraps of dough; re roll to ⁄2 inch (1.3 cm) thickness and cut as before.
Place doughnuts on baking sheets coated with cooking spray; brush 2 tablespoons melted margarine over doughnuts.
steps.description: Let rise, uncovered, in a warm, draft-free place for 40 minutes.

steps.headline: Combine 1/2 sugar and 1 teaspoon cinnamon in a large zip-top heavy duty plastic bag, and set aside.
Bake doughnuts at 425 degrees for 8 minutes or until golden.
Immediately brush remaining 2 tablespoon melted margarine over baked doughnuts:put doughnuts in to plastic bag.
Seal the bag and shake to coat.

text: Dissolve the yeast in warm water in a large bowl and let it stand 5 minutes.  Add three cups flour, applesauce, and the next 6 ingredients (see ingredients): beat at low speed of electric mixer until moistened.  Beat at medium speed for an additional 2 minutes.  Stir in 2 cups of flour, 1/2 cups at a time, to form a soft dough.  Turn out onto a well-floured surface.  Knead until smooth and elastic(about 5 minutes); add enough remaining flour, 1 tablespoon at a time, to prevent dough from sticking to hands.  Place dough in a bowl coated with cooking spray. Turn over to coat top. Cover and let rise in a warm place, free from drafts for 1 hour or until doubled in bulk.  Punch dough down, and turn out onto a lightly floured surface.  Roll dough to a ⁄2 inch (1.3 cm) thickness:cut it lightly  Combine doughnut holes and any remaining scraps of dough; re roll to ⁄2 inch (1.3 cm) thickness and cut as before.  Place doughnuts on baking sheets coated with cooking spray; brush 2 tablespoons melted margarine over doughnuts. Let rise, uncovered, in a warm, draft-free place for 40 minutes. Combine 1/2 sugar and 1 teaspoon cinnamon in a large zip-top heavy duty plastic bag, and set aside.  Bake doughnuts at 425 degrees for 8 minutes or until golden.  Immediately brush remaining 2 tablespoon melted margarine over baked doughnuts:put doughnuts in to plastic bag.  Seal the bag and shake to coat.  Finished.
